38098590.review:
If you want a quality hidden object game with good puzzles and hidden object scenes, then try the “Lost Land”-series. Dark Overlord is no exception. It has a lot of playtime – and after some time you can replay it with almost the same joy as the first time.

The Ukrainian developer FIVE-BN GAMES really know their metier. The game is in the high end of the genre. Try it out – several of their games have a free demo version. 

That was the thing that hooked me up quite some time ago. I tried it, and then came back for the full version – well: Versions of almost all of their games.

35505113.review: Całkiem przyjemna HOPA z kilkoma nowatorskimi, niespotykanymi - jak na ten gatunek - rozwiązaniami. Zagadki logiczne miejscami niebanalne, choć jak na mój gust trochę za mało plansz HO, ale to ostatnio dominujący trend. Obiecujący początek serii.

34458051.review:
Une mère de famille recherche dans un monde parallèle son fils qui a été enlevé par une mystérieuse créature maléfique.
On traverse une forêt enchantée, des grottes dans un univers peuplé d'âmes maudites.

Je m'attendais à un jeu d'objets cachés mais les SOC ne sont finalement pas si fréquentes que ça et l'essentiel du jeu est la recherche d'objets utiles à la progression ainsi que quelques mini-jeux comme dans un véritable jeu d'aventure.
Une belle durée de vie pour ce genre de jeu, d'autant plus avec l'épisode bonus, sans jamais être vraiment trop longtemps bloqué à tourner en rond ou obligé de faire des aller-retours, malgré quelques défis un poil plus relevés que les autres. Par contre, il ne faut évidemment pas s'attendre à un scénario très profond ni très original, l'intrigue n'étant qu'un prétexte pour proposer les énigmes.

Jeu avec textes en français mais voix en anglais dont le titre est traduit par "Le Seigneur des Ténèbres".
Il y a 3 niveaux de difficulté et on peut même en créer un personnalisé mais honnêtement ce genre de jeu doit se jouer en difficulté maximale. Ca n'empêche d'ailleurs pas d'avoir accès à un journal, une carte (avec déplacements rapides) et même des indices.
Les SOC peuvent être de différents types : la classique recherche d'objets d'après une liste ou une image, devoir placer des objets dans la scène à un emplacement logique et parfois il faut utiliser les objets dans la scène.

Dans l'épisode bonus, on se retrouve dans la même forêt mais très vite on se retrouve dans un monde sous-marin inédit.



Je peux donc vraiment recommander ce jeu.

So almost any HOG game is perfect for me, it have to very bad to disappoint me and this one is very good :)

31805134.review:
Excellent Hidden Object game. I've played many and this one is truly a cut above the rest. Far more puzzles than hidden object scenes and a great story to boot.

The graphics and voice acting are better than average and the story was good enough to hold my attention throughout. 

At 4 hours gameplay it didn't outstay it's welcome and is worth the price. If you like this style of game then this is truly one of the best in the genre.

9/10 Dark overlords would play again.

31425697.review:
J'évalue en groupe Lost Lands Dark Overlord, The Four Horsemenn et The Golden Curse que j'ai acheté en même temps et fait en suivant vu que je n'ai pas trouvé de grosses diffèrences de principe entre les 3.

J'ai beaucoup aimé la variété des énigmes. Il ya des objets cachés, des objets à assembler, plein de mini-jeux de logique ou d'observation, images à apparier, puzzles, taquins, labyrinthes... Le coeur du jeu est vraiment de trouver des objets et résoudre des énigmes. L'aventure est assez secondaire. L'histoire aux multiples rebondissements déclinés en courtes séquences n'est qu'un prétexte à enchainer les énigmes dans un univers parallèle de type heroic fantasy dopé aux créatures mythologique très agréable à parcourir mais qui ne fera pas d'ombre aux grands noms du genre.

Le principal écueil est finalement l'imbrication des énigmes qui nous perd un peu en route. A force de chercher un objet nécéssaire à la résolution d'une énigme dans une autre énigme qui elle-même à besoin d'un autre objet accessible par une autre énigme et ainsi de suite, tous dans des lieux diffèrents sur lesquels on revient très souvent, j'ai fini par ne plus trop savoir où j'en étais et suivre les points allumés par l'aide sur la carte. Idem pour les objets à collectionner, il y en a un peu partout et certains sont très/trop bien intégré au décor, si bien que j'ai aussi utilisé l'aide carte. Après coup je me dis qu'à moins d'avoir une excellente mémoire ou être un as de la prise de note, faire ce jeu du premier coup sans les aides doit pouvoir être très très crispant. Pas par les allées et venues en elles-mêmes car les trajets se font instantanément via la carte mais par la complexité artificielle que leur multiplication ajoute à la résolution des problèmes proposés.

A noter aussi au rayon pénible quelques noms d'objets erronnés (traduction peut-être ?) et une relance régulière pour évaluer le jeu dans The Golden Curse, bon, ce n'est pas toutes les 2 minutes mais c'est un peu lourdingue sur plusieurs parties.

30356897.review: 游戏呢，是个好游戏。作为一款冒险解密类游戏，其套路也好、操作也罢，和一般的冒险解密类游戏没有什么两样。当然具体到一些细节上，稍微有些不一样，但大体上没有什么不同。所以玩过冒险解密类游戏的玩家，绝对没有什么违和感。画面也很精美，我是说，这类游戏本来都是用于手机或者是平板，在电脑上玩其实是属于移植，所以，你也不能太挑剔了。这类游戏对电脑本身要求很低，所以你也不需要考虑什么优化问题。具体到这款游戏，魔幻特效做的很不错。要说缺点，其实不是游戏本身，而是，制作公司，您老人家就不能出个官方的中文版本吗？！！！那怕是繁体的也行。出个官方的中文版就那么难吗？！！！你会死啊？！！！害的我为了看懂游戏里面的英文，不得不经常用百度翻译。唉，悲催啊，有木有……

29970872.review:
This is a solid HO/puzzle game with very nice visuals and sounds. The usual quick story is present. A dark force has taken your son and you have to save him. 

The puzzles and HO scenes are well done. Everything is crisp even at 1440p. There are a lot of puzzles here, but they are not too difficult. The HO scenes are pretty standard. Occasionally, they change it up where you have to use items they give you and find the matching object on the scene. 

The art and drawings are very detailed and vibrant. Way better than average and is a shining point to the game. 

You are able to fast travel using the map. Also, you can customize the difficulty to suit your needs.

There are a small number of collectibles throughout the game. With some extra time scanning the scenes, you should be able to find them all. 

I had 3 minor interface issues while playing. 

-The map button is too close to the Hint button. You could accidentally press it trying to look at the map.
-The map button has an odd clickable area to activate it. 
-It can be easy to accidentally back out of a HO scene or puzzle by moving the cursor down to the bottom of the screen. 

[b]Pros[/b]
+Really nice and vibrant visuals
+Variety of HO scenes and puzzles
+Nice music and sound effects

[b]Cons[/b]
+Map button placement and clicking oddities
+Easy to accidentally back out of HO or puzzle scene
+Ads for other games before you reach the starting screen

Another HOG that hits all of the expected points. I enjoyed playing this and only wish it was longer!

[b]7/10[/b] Good

La storia è assolutamente fantastica, e il capitolo bonus la rende ancora più preziosa. Le scene con oggetti nascosti sono notevoli, perché “interattive” ed intelligenti. I mini-giochi hanno una loro logica, mentre la ricerca di tutti gli oggetti da collezionare ci assicura altri extra piacevoli. Mappa ben fatta ed utilissima (lasciate pure perdere la guida strategica: nella versione in lingua italiana è comunque in inglese), immagini e filmati di grande valore, traduzioni (quasi) impeccabili, musiche non all’altezza però gradevoli… Ma soprattutto una lunghezza del gioco che fino ad ora, per me, non ha eguali. Consigliatissimo!

24467121.review:
[b]In a nutshell:[/b] Play it. It's a good, solid HOPA with great visuals and a variety of HO style scenes to mix things up. 

After playing a rash of disappointing HOPAs, I was pleasantly surprised by this one. 

[h1]The Good Stuff[/h1]
+ [b]Great art.[/b] 
The 3D cutscene animations are a bit stiff, but the scenes, backgrounds, objects, and even effects are stunning. 
+ [b]Variety of HO styles.[/b] 
There are 3 kinds of hidden object scenes: the usual text list form with some two-step items, the "find then use" silhouette mode, and a pair-matching mode where you're given a handful of items to place or use in the scene with objects they typically go with (put a weight on a scale, use a matchbox to light a candle, add a boot/sock/glove to make a pair, etc). It takes a bit getting used to, but it's nice to see more than just lists all the time. All the scenes are nicely rendered, and objects are logical and scaled well for their surroundings.
+ [b]Decent puzzle difficulty.[/b] 
Not too easy, but not overly challenging. Difficulty falls into that comfortable middle ground that suits most casual players.
+ [b]Good use of sound.[/b] 
I never found myself wincing at SFX or music. They're fitting to the point of barely noticing how much they affect the ambiance. Some of the SFX for finishing puzzles or actions like "hooray, you placed that thing in the right spot!" were actually pretty satisfying.
+ [b]Good voiceovers.[/b] 
While nearly anything qualifies as a good voiceover after you've played [i]Dreamatorium 2[/i] (*twitch*), in this case the VOs are more fitting and impressive than I've seen in many other top-tier HOPAs. They aren't overused either, and no unnecessary audio commentary for every single thing you click on.
+ [b]Likeable characters.[/b] 
I found Uri and the lake/cave spirits to be quite charming. The way they were written, voiced, and animated gives them a particular kind of appeal.
+ [b]Text is clear.[/b] 
I only spotted one or two insignificant grammar errors, and a single instance of a mislabelled item ("needle" when it should say "tongs")
+ [b]Multi-use tools.[/b] 
One of the biggest frustrations of HOG players is the "one-use-crowbar", or blades that break after cutting a piece of yarn. But in this game the dagger and owl you find at the beginning stay with you and are usable throughout the entire game. 
+ [b]Precise map and hint system.[/b] 
While you may want to avoid the map and hints if you're going for those achievements, they're a lot more useful than I've seen in other games. Unlike the typical HOPA hint that just points to the exit of the scene you're in, here it actually opens the map and circles where you're supposed to go. Fast travel is also lag-free, at least in my experience.
+ [b]In-game strategy guide.[/b] 
I normally keep a walkthrough on hand in case I get stuck (or impatient), so it was nice to have the official one available via the UI itself at any point in the game. It's especially useful for the various collectibles.
+ [b]Excellent bonus chapter.[/b] 
It's a common joke by now that Collector's Edition bonus chapters are the laziest and most unfinished part of HOPAs, riddled with errors, bug/glitches, and horrendous mistranslations. But Lost Lands is one of they VERY few I've seen with a bonus chapter just as good as the main game. It's like someone actually put thought into the whole package. Shocking, I know.
+ [b]Easy achievements. [/b]
If you don't mind playing on Hard difficulty from the get-go, you can get 100% in one playthrough.

[h1]Iffy Stuff[/h1]
I honestly don't have anything bad to say about this game, but here are a few nitpicks that don't necessarily detract from gameplay (except the first one a tiny bit):
- [b]Bonus Chapter bug[/b] (I think).
In the bonus chapter there's a point where you have to go to the "Old Forest Entrance", but there's no conceivable way to get there other than through the map/fast travel. You can move [i]backward[/i] from that forest entrance and end up in the first underwater area, but unless I missed something obvious I couldn't find the reverse entry hotspot no matter what I tried. It's a good thing that bug isn't in the main chapter/game, because it would make the "use the map less than 5 times" achievement impossible.
- [b]The Alchemist.[/b]
The animation for the alchemist is weirdly out of place. It's a completely different style of art, with none of the fluid movement of the other cutscenes. It looked like someone took their side project of a talking claymation sorcerer and just plopped it in as a supporting character. It wouldn't be the first time I've seen devs use existing assets from their minor projects to supplement a bigger game, but they could at least have made the art style fit a little better. Not really a "problem" obviously, but as an artist those things tend to pop out at me.
- [b]No technical replay value. [/b]
I say "technical" because I can see myself replaying this at some point for the whole experience. But puzzle layouts/difficulties and hidden object lists don't change at all between Easy/Normal/Hard. Objects are not randomized and lists don't rotate, so every game will be [i]exactly[/i] the same. 

Overall though, I'd rank [b]Lost Lands: Dark Overlord[/b] in the top third of my HOPA recommendation list, alongside titles like Dark Heritage: Guardians of Hope, Eventide: Slavic Fable, and Nearwood. 

Just go ahead and play it already. :p

24330980.review:
Dark Overlord is a solid hidden object game.

With 3 difficulty levels, it can be quite casual, but on hard and not using the map to see places that have actions (achievement!), it becomes an exercise in hunting: you need to find the leaf which hides that object that is missing for you to proceed. If you play more casually, there are sparkles and hints to help you with that.

The graphics are music are beautiful, the puzzles are decent for the genre (that is, they're casual), and the story is mostly nonexistent and wouldn't take more than a page if written down. That is why I wouldn't call this a point&click adventure - the focus is definitely on the puzzles and not on the narrative. On the upside, that's also why the game has replay value: you're unlikely to have found everything on your first go (although it is possible), so to get those 100% achievements, you need to replay it and do everything (and correctly) this time, without help.

Recommended if you like hidden object games.

[i]This game runs fine on my old Windows XP computer.[/i]

21958203.review:
一个中规中矩的寻物解谜游戏，还自带攻略，良心啊。
    有2个坑爹的成就，
    “Tidy”看要求是在列表寻物模式下没有错误点击，实际上是要求在主游戏里三个列表寻物模式下没有错误，没信心的只能看着自带攻略一点点找吧。
    “Pathfinder”要求在主游戏里使用地图不超过5次。我不知道“使用地图”是什么意思，是就看了下地图呢还是用地图瞬移。个人猜测是用地图瞬移。不过没去实践求证。谁证实了告诉我。

21096608.review:
[h1]Short version: 85%[/h1]
Dark Overlord has wonderful puzzle design, great variety in hidden object mechanics, and beautiful graphics. It has only one significant flaw, the insane levels of backtracking.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Building a good hidden object game, especially one that uses the most frequent setup in the genre (a mother’s son gets kidnapped by an unnamed dark entity, so she enters a magical forest and dark castle to save him) is a difficult task. Lost Lands: Dark Overlord managed to overcome this obstacle.
Its greatest weapon to balance the fairly clichéd story was the graphics. They are not just eye candy (especially if we look at some of those impressive perspectives), but also a tool that helps the player to get immersed in this strange, yet somehow familiar fantasy world.

Another strong point is the puzzle design, especially the hidden object scenes. The game features three types: conventional list-based, item matching, and sequential (find objects to uncover more objects). Their variety alone is enough to excuse the somewhat ridiculous amounts and lengths of backtracking needed, even if said backtracking can really grind the player’s nerves towards the last stages.

20708560.review: Very good HOG game worth a buy thumbs up.

20483971.review:
When your son is abducted by a shadow, you're thrown into a story of dwarves, dark lord and the renaissance of this evil entity. Will you manage to save the world and your son by preventing the Dark Lord to come back to life?

While the story is common in the HOG world, it's still a good one and a well-written, as you'll be helped by spirits, ghosts and a dwarf.

Anyway, the gameplay is the standard one: puzzles, hidden objects scenes, etc.. However, this game is quite interesting as the minigames are easy to solve and the hidden objects scenes are divided in three types: placing the object at the right place, finding the object corresponding at the silhouette and the traditionnal list of objects. However, each scene contains a close-up of a part of it - without forgetting the objects hidden in the scene that will require an action.

The graphics are correct, the backgrounds are also beautiful but after one moment, it was kinda long. Perhaps because I was in the mood of achievements hunting. Because the downside of the game are achievements. Some of them are quite hard to obtain despite the description - like the HO list without misclick. Given the nature of the list scenes, it's easier to unlock it in the bonus chapter, at the last HO because there was only one red item (hidden object). Also, I don't know why the painting games without misclick didn't unlock the first time as I never did a mistake.

Anyway, the bonus are also good: puzzles, minigames to replay (and unlock achievements you may miss although the paitings ones isn't working), concept arts, etc..

The bonus chapter is set after the main chapter, though there is a little problem: your character has now long hair.... but in the cutscenes, she has short hair again as part of recycling movies.

Anyway, the game is pretty good. It's a good and enjoyable one. I can recommend this one eyes closed.

19783792.review:
Nothing is more effective then a tenacious mother looking for her child.

Storyline: Jimmy (3-5 years old) is lured away from his mother's side by a softly calling voice while she is speaking on the phone. (I would assume they are at home or she would have not taken the call I am sure.)  Susan, his mother, realizing her son has wandered off into the woods, goes after him only to see him being pulled into a mysterious swirling, glowing vortex in a tree trunk.  Before she can reach him he disappears in the tree trunk leaving only his teddy bear behind.  What does a concerned and tenacious mother do, she goes after him, of course.  Once she reaches the Lost Lands, as her new found dwarf friend explains, he also tells her an ancient evil has tainted the lands and in order to retrieve her son she must defeat this dark and evil presence.  Sure, no problem.  And with teddy bear in hand, she proceeds to do just that.

Gameplay: Mostly a point and click game but with enough hidden object scenes to keep it a hidden object game and plenty of puzzles.  Nothing too hard and the puzzles relatively easy. (Matching, sliders, circles, logic, color, recipe)  The game moves along in a relatively open world yet extremely linear fashion.  How can it be both, one may ask?  The linear movement of the story line moves along quite rapidly, however, the open world part comes into play because there are bottlenecks.  To get past each bottleneck the gamer must complete all the tasks needed to get past the bottleneck, which can be done in any order the gamer choses though limited to found inventory items.  Actually all the bottlenecks can be opened even before all tasks needed to complete the game are accomplished.  For an experienced HO gamer this should send up a little red flag that says 'backtracking', which there is a lot of if one missed something or the item in question can not be gotten yet.

On the subject of back tracking, there is a fast travel map.  But wait my friends, especially my achievement hunting friends, there are penalties, lots of them.  There are penalties for map use (and by default fast travel), for misclicks, for hints, for everything really, so pay attention to what one does or one will be playing the game more then once.  Ah yes, you read that correctly.  This game can be totally completed and ALL ACHIEVEMENTS EARNED in a SINGLE playthrough.  No forced second playthrough here, especially since there is a built in strategy guide in case one gets stuck.  So go ahead and play on the hard level the first time through.  There are even ACHIEVEMENTS IN the BONUS CHAPTER and some missed achievements can even be earned in the bonus chapter.  (Now that is a first for me, who has played HO games for 10+ years and owns well over a hundred HO games.)  Kudos to the developers, I really like that feature.

A warning and caution for my achievement hunting friends, I suggest you actually read the achievements before playing because there are achievements 1) that are missable, 2) if over zealous and one only partially completes the puzzle (usually to get the stuff out of inventory) then leaves the puzzle the achievement is lost  (finding the shells immediately comes to mind ~ bonus chapter ~ ALL NINE shells need to placed on the 1st TRY and without any misclicks), 3) misclicks (One can lose several achievements over this. The fore mentioned one being one of them.) and 4) map use ~ limit 5 uses.  Advise: DO NOT USE THE MAP or one will be playing the game again.  

There are extra hidden objects (with attached achievements, of course), four sets: snails, pine cones, skulls, and snakes.  These extra objects change as one progresses through the game (and the change can be used as an area marker) and overlap between area sections. (There are basically 4 areas: town, mine, castle, wizard's tower.)  These objects are easy to see and easy to find.  But they are also easy to miss if one forgets or in a transistion zone.  Fortunately there is a "tracking" button one can click on to see how many are needed or left to be found in the "area".  

Easy and challenging at the same time.  Fun, despite the backtracking.  Comes with built in strategy guide, has extras like wallpapers, concept art, music, plus 4 picture puzzles to do.  Well worth the price, plus it has a sequel game (Lost Lands: The Four Horsemen).  One last thing, I like the fact Susan wears glasses.  An unusual detail that stands out to me as both a cost to the developers and as a personal trait for the character.

19507817.review:
Игра очень похожа на Nearwood, хотя разработчики, вроде, разные. И там и там попаданцы, три локации, гном-советник и геймплей в беготне.
Но здесь гораздо более банальные локации: болотная деревня, шахты гномов, брошеный замок. Художники, конечно, постарались, но изначально концепты скучные.
Очень много собирания всяких наборов - драгоценные камни, куски барельефа, ракушки, амулеты. Причем игра их не группирует и либо ходишь с полным инвентарем (который надо прокручивать), либо постоянно бегаешь, чтобы вставить в очередной разъем очередной кусок.
HOG-сцены простые, разнообразные (по списку, подбор пар, комбинирование предметов). Но в награду получаешь очередной кусок.
Так что по итогам из игры не запоминается ничего.
Не рекомендую не потому что ужас-ужас, ни в коем случае не играть, а просто потому что не за что рекомендовать.

18980776.review:
Lost Lands: Dark Overlord is a better-than-average HOG.  There's no repetition of the HO scenes, plenty of other puzzles and minigames in the mix and the type of HO scene (list, silhoutte, association) varies to keep it feeling fresh.  The story's the usual fluff about a loved one being abducted into a fantastic world, and the voice acting is just barely tolerable, but the cut-scenes are very nice-looking.

I found this game a bit less challenging than average for the genre, but note that attempting to get every achievement in a single playthrough would add a steep challenge factor for those who are so inclined.

18485436.review: "Lost Lands: Dark Overlord" is an excellent game.  It's got a good story, good game play, good puzzles, and very good voice acting (except for the Alchemist).  I'd say the best thing about it is the density and complexity of the puzzles.  It's definitely a challenging game.  I don't know if you'd consider it a plus or a minus, but there's a LOT of running back and forth across the map to solve things.  But, the foot traffic makes logical sense.  I got 9.3 hours of excellent play time out of the game (6.2 hours for the main game (on Hard), another 1.8 hours in the bonus chapter (which was very well done, too), and then another 1.3 hours re-doing parts of the main game to get some missing Achievements.  So, this game is well worth even the current list price of about $7.

18210422.review: A fun and good looking game. The extras are  a very nice touch including wallpaper for my resolution 1680*1050. Nice.  The game tells a good story and sound and graphics are very good. It even includes a bonus game. A solid HOG.

18136207.review:
Very easy, quick casual adventure and Hidden Object game.

This game focuses more on collecting objects to reach new areas and has very few Hidden Object scenes and puzzles. The HO scenes require little effort as there are few items in scene besides the one your looking for. The story element is also easy as you have a limited inventory and so only few logical choices. Only a few logic puzzles which aren't taxing. The graphics are nice and sound is okay. The story is again okay.

There is an in game strategy guide/cheat sheet, but if you are going to use it you may as use the free hint/skips; and might want to consider checking the toxicity of your crayons.

Overall I would give this an okay. Good for crayon eaters.

18125824.review:
An excellent and long casual point-and-click game with several mini-games and a handful of hidden-object scenes. Even the bonus chapter is fairly lengthy, and it's as good as the rest of the game. And get this: the sequel is even better!

This game shines with the point-and-click adventuring: there is a lot to do, and it's sometimes challenging. All in all, all the puzzles are very well balanced and obviously thoroughly playtested. There are lots of attainable achievements, and they are fully synced with Steam.

The graphics are good, and the cut scenes are exceptional. The story is neither amazing nor original, but serves well to keep the adventure going. Yes, it's yet another middle-aged woman saving her young son from the clutches of evil. I wonder what the target audience for these games is... ;)

The one weak part of the game is the terrible voice acting and dialog, at least for the English edition. But that's a small quibble for what is otherwise a very enjoyable way to spend a few hours. Highly recommended for fans of the casual point-and-clicks and HOGs!

18087564.review:
Jak lubisz HOPA, to ta gra Ci się spodoba. Wszystko jest tu dobrze dopasowane, choć może dziwić to, że samego typowego szukania obiektów jest dosyć mało, ale za to w ramach rekompensaty będziemy wielokrotnie przeczesywać lokacje w poszukiwaniu nam potrzebnych przedmiotów, a zagadki logiczne są na satysfakcjonującym gracza poziomie. Do tego grafika, która jak na ten gatunek robi wrażenie.
7/10

17950564.review: Awesome !! Would recommend for anyone that likes puzzle/point and click.

17852954.review: One of the best Hidden Object Games on Steam. Well detailed graphics, nice puzzles and the HO scenes are especially interesting: in some of them you have to solve mini puzzles, some ask you to put objects in particular places of the scenes and of course there are the classic ones with the list of hidden things to find. There's also an extra chapter at the end of the main adventure and different difficulty levels available. I finished the main game and the extra chapter in 4 hours at the hardest difficulty so I guess the game's duration is good, too.

17769799.review:
I am not a huge fan of hidden object games, but they can be a nice way to relax. However, games made by FIVE-BN GAMES  are quite different. Hidden objects are actually mini games within a much bigger adventure and they simply take this whole genre to another level.

Puzzles are fun, locations are beautiful and there is NO PIXEL HUNTING which is a big BIG thing for this kind of game. I personally would recommend you to start the game on HARD immediately because it provides the most fun (playing on EASY is just too simple and if you complete the game like that, even HARD becomes too simple because... well, you already know where to go and what to do anyway).

Thumbs up for this fun FUN game!

17747407.review:
You don't mess with moms in hidden object games, they will kick your butt!

This game! I had a lot of fun playing this game, I even went through it twice to finish the achievements. It's a solid hidden object game with a decent enough story. It has plenty of challenge to keep you busy and has that "it" factor that makes you want to sit and play it for hours.

The story is a bit cliche. A demon has your son kidnapped and you go through great lengths to rescue him and become a hero to this magical land, you even get dragged back in the bonus chapter AND the sequel! One issue I found is that the demon is just like...a shadow or smoke figure so he can't actually ever hurt you or do anything. It seemed shockingly easy, story wise, to save the boy. However, it wasn't a bad story at all. Just typical hidden object fair.

The game play, however, was top notch. It was challenging and enjoyable at the same time. Lots of point and click aspects mixed in with hidden object scenes. The added Steam achievements create even more challenge if you're on a mission to collect them all. You also have a short, but still entertaining bonus chapter at the end of the main game. My biggest issue was the amount of back tracking. As one of the achievements is not use the map over five times, this leaves you endlessly going backwards then forwards a lot. Finding the item you need to finish a puzzle that is located at the beginning of the game can be a chore.

Overall, the game is great. Gripes aside I had hours of fun with this and if you're a fan of the genre I believe you will too. It's fully voice acted and has lovely artwork to entice your eyes, it's all around great.

17739841.review:
Nice graphics, customizable difficulty levels, and some variations on the hidden object scenes (like the "reverse hidden object" puzzles, where you have a list of objects and have to find a logical place for them). I also appreciate that the achievements are mainly things that might take some effort to accomplish, like completing specific puzzles within a time limit/with no mistakes. I mean, that's what achievements [i]should[/i] be. "Achievement unlocked: Congratulations! You're playing the game!" always feels so condescending.

It has the usual issues with the genre, like having to run around the map collecting puzzle pieces that are there for no good reason, and endings (particularly in the bonus game) that barely rise above "YOUR WINNER." But overall it's a solid title for hidden object game fans.

17725578.review:
This is a very well presented casual adventure game. It has the right amount of hidden object scenes, puzzles and mini-games without getting either too lengthy or having too much of one of the three. The difficulty level is not too hard, but some of the mini-games and puzzles aren't that easy.

The graphics and music are really great. Every location has its own style while not becoming random and it's fun to explore the game. The pre-rendered 3D graphics look very detailed and colorful. While the voice acting is okay, the music fits the game very well and never gets on your nerves.

There are three different kinds of hidden object scenes and two of them require you to really think about the scene rather than just searching for the objects. I really enjoyed this change and it certainly adds to the adventure aspect. The puzzle elements range from 'find the right shape' to almost old school point and click ones. Again the more challenging puzzles keep the game interesting.

This is a real gem if you like casual adventure games and I was surprised how well designed (in both gameplay and presentation) the game is.

17254966.review:
Красивая, удобная в управлении игра, с интересной историей.
Пазлы и головоломки не наскучивают, красиво оформлены и анимированны.
Вообще в игре замечательное графическо-визуальное составляющее.
Достойная игра в своём жанре.

17026024.review:
Review originally written for [url=walawalagames.com/]WalaWala Games[/url]

This is a fairly typical hidden object styled game, and as such, both story and the general logic behind some of the puzzles and items to acquire follow a similar path (and thus, similar downfalls) to most other games of the genre: meaning it’s nothing original and logic flies out the window half the time. 
That said, Lost Lands: Dark Overlord is definitely a bit above the average HOG game, and definitely on a good path.

Let’s start with the audiovisual. The background art is really nice; they pay plenty of attention to background details, and most of the areas are really beautiful. The models and characters are pretty decent, but them, as well as the voices given to them, suffer from lack of expression. The characters ‘smile’ by hardly moving their mouths in an upward fashion, the mother’s re-encounter with her son goes only as far as a half heartfelt “Oh, jimmy.” and overall it’s just not the best. However, it’s also not the worst I’ve encountered, and you can kind of tell there was an attempt at giving some sort of emotional intonation to the text.
The cutscenes were alright too, though there were a couple ‘transitional’ ones that I’m not sure were really needed. The music was nice, soft enough that I was not bothered by it, and seemed to fit the setting.

The game has various difficulties: Easy/normal/hard plus a slightly custom one as you can select how fast or slow hints take to recharge and what you want ‘help’ with or not, which was a really nice addition.

Once in, you’ll find it also has many collectables to find throughout the areas in the main story, all of which were quite easy to spot - I’d think this lowers the replayability quite a bit, as completionists will surely not miss them on the first play through and thus would have no reason to go back and replay it. 

There are several things I really enjoyed about it: 

+ It has a decent map system with fast travel - clicking on a map location takes you straight to it. The map also has the typical hints of where something needs doing and where you are, as well as an added hint of where you haven’t found a collectable yet (but only if you play it on easy, normal, or custom with those selected).

+ There was a little ‘pet’ you find that helps you with getting certain items. I always enjoy when they add little companions because it somehow makes you not feel so ‘alone’. 

+ The customization choices for the difficulty (which I took full advantage of).

+ The great variety of puzzles. 

Though most of the puzzles were a little too easy, I did enjoy playing through most of them. Lost Lands: Dark Overlord has a great variety, having only a few hidden object scenes (a couple by list, a couple by shape), some ‘logical pair’ scenes (flower with vase, etc), and puzzles ranging from slider to swapping to connecting and rearranging, to repair and/or reassemble the machine and a few recipe-based “make this item”, which I really like… It kept the game fresh not to have too many repeats. 

Another interesting feature was that, in some of the puzzles where you first needed to find everal of an item, you would usually find most of those together in one single location. Some you still had to find separately, of course, but not having to find every single glass shard of a stained window, for instance, was actually quite nice. 

Something I would have liked to have was for more of the ‘press things in a specific order’ puzzles to have the ability to put the little piece of paper with the order nearby to see it as you could in some of the rearranging puzzles. It got a bit tiresome having to open the book every time if you couldn’t recall the order.

The hidden object scenes were also rather easy, as some of the items stood out a bit too much (I seriously ended up getting at least half of them without even reading the list first). 

There were no outstanding bugs through my gameplay, though my game did crash once (when I tried to switch from full screen to window in the middle of the game) and froze another time (for no reason whatsoever). Fortunately, it seems to have a pretty sturdy auto-saving system for I went back both times exactly to where I had left off and I was able to play on without major issues. 

There was one thing that was a bit bothersome though, and that is: when you start the bonus chapter, on the initial sequence when she dreams about being needed, her hair is longer than on the main story; yet when she’s going through the portal and afterwards her hair is shorter again (and she’s wearing other clothes, too) as the cutscene was clearly reused from the main storyline. While I can see why the scene was reused, it was a bit of a sloppy thing that removed consistency in the storyline. 
I’m also confused as to why the initial dream sequence seems like it’s setting up the bonus as a horror story when it’s not, haha. Maybe that last was just me reading too much into it, though. 

I was lucky to get the Collector’s Edition to review. As usual, these come with a bunch of unlockable extras (wallpapers, concept art, etc), the choice to replay puzzles 8without having to replay the entire game), as well as the main story + bonus story (in which you go back to help some underwater beings from being extinct). The main story is fairly short, and the bonus is even shorter. With just around 3 hours of gameplay between both, Lost Lands: Dark Overlord might not be challenging or overly original, but it’s still fun to play.

I’ll be looking forward to see how they improve on future releases!

16765757.review: A nice game, and makes you think

39532650.review:
Среди себе подобных крайне достойный экземпляр. Ничего не могу с собой поделать, ну нравятся мне такие игры и все. Сюжет этой, банален (как и почти всех подобнных). Мама ночью останавливается в какой-то глуши чтобы погворить по телефону (на кой черт, непонятно), при этом сын играет рядом, теряет игрушку, бежит за ней, его сжирает дерево и переносит в параллельный мир, где нерадивая мамаша его впоследствии и спасает. Отличные катсцены, великолепная рисовка локаций и неплохой саундтрек в наличии. Множество самых разнообразных мини-игр, над некоторыми из них реально пришлось поломать голову. Поиск предметов тоже реализован достойно. Есть три вида поиска: по описанию, по силуэту и по логике. В последнем нужно данные предметы подставдлять к предметам в локации следуя логике. Не сложно, но такое попадается в жанре нечасто. Помимо основной истории, после ее прохождения, есть бонусная глава. Она напрямую относится к основному сюжету и вполне добротно сделана. Так же в этом издании куча дополннительных материалов. Обои, саундтрек, концепты и т.д.. В целом игра сделана очень добротно и чувствуется, что делали ее с душой. Из минусов отмечу только отсутствие карточек. Любителям жанра однозначно рекомендую к покупке.
9 мамаш raspizdyaek из 10
